480.title: Relating to the theft of consumer identity protections
480.description: The purpose of this bill is to include protection for theft of identity information of persons 60 years of age or older or individuals under 18 years of age.Â The bill; adds definitions; provides that a report to law-enforcement agency that a person’s identifying information has been lost or stolen is prima facie evidence of identity theft.Â And the bill provides both misdemeanor and felony penalties for violations.

481.title: Relating to the removal of the severance tax on oil and gas produced from low producing oil and natural gas wells
481.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the severance tax on oil and gas produced from low producing wells.

482.title: Preventing proposing or enforcing rules that prevent recreational water facilities from making necessary upgrades
482.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the secretary from proposing or enforcing any rules which prevent recreational water facilities from making necessary upgrades, renovations, or repairs.

483.title: Providing certain employees of the Highways increases in annual pay
483.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide regional field employees of the Division of Highways increases in annual pay.

484.title: Relating to mandatory reporting procedures of abuse and neglect of adults and children
484.description: The purpose of this bill is to direct all reports of abuse and neglect to the central office of DHHR via communications method established by the department.

486.title: Relating to the ineligibility for home incarceration for offenders under certain circumstances
486.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the sentence of home incarceration unavailable to an offender convicted of two or more unrelated felony offenses, not arising from the same criminal transaction on a prior occasion in this jurisdiction or any jurisdiction within the United States.

487.title: Authorizing certain West Virginia courthouse security officers to carry concealed firearms
487.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize certain West Virginia courthouse security officers to carry concealed firearms; authorize arrest powers to courthouse security officers under certain circumstances; prescribe requirements for permission to carry concealed firearms; and the legislative intent.

488.title: Shifting funding from the Landfill Closure Assistance Fund to local solid waste authorities
488.description: The purpose of this bill is to shift funding from the Landfill Closure Assistance Fund, which was set up in 1991 to properly close old landfills across the state, to local solid waste authorities.Â According to the 2017 West Virginia Solid Waste Management Plan, 28 of the 35 old landfills have been properly remediated by the fund.Â Given the progress made towards closure of the old landfills, the portion of the solid waste fee assessed on landfill deposits, which is currently sent to the fund, is being reduced in order to accommodate an in-kind increase in the portion of the solid waste fee charged by county or regional solid waste authorities to fund various recycling, litter control, and other locally important solid waste programs.Â Additionally, this bill would allow for a reduction in the use of county commission/county tax dollars currently used to support various recycling, litter control, and other locally important solid waste programs.

489.title: Relating to the whistle-blower law
489.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend or clarify protections under the state’s whistle-blower law.

490.title: Allowing municipalities to prepay their annual contributions to the policemen's or firemen's pension and relief fund
490.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow municipalities to prepay their annual pension obligations to the policemen’s or firemen’s pension fund.

491.title: Relating to the publication of sample ballots for electronic voting machines
491.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a more cost-effective system of publication of sample ballots for electronic voting machines. Currently, county commissions interpret the law to allow only publication of screenshots of the voting machine screens. The screens are substantially larger than absentee ballot images, and publication of such will substantially decrease WV’s counties’ legal publication costs.

492.title: Exempting certain hygiene products from sales tax
492.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt feminine hygiene products and diapers from state sales tax.

493.title: Authorizing municipal fire departments specialized license plates
493.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Motor Vehicles to issue special motor vehicle plates for municipal fire department vehicles.

494.title: Prohibiting registered sex offenders from participating in Halloween activities
494.description: The purpose of this to prohibit registered sex offenders from participating in Halloween activities. The bill requires certain signage and establishes criminal penalties.

495.title: Relating to court actions
495.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend certain procedures in child neglect or abuse cases. The bill requires a petition to include an accusatory statement; provides when a court may and may not appoint counsel; and it removes the provision permitting copetitioners each to have counsel.

496.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
496.title: Relating to complimentary samples of nonintoxicating beer or nonintoxicating craft beer
496.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit licensed brewpubs, Class A retail dealers, Class B retail dealers, private clubs, Class A retail licensees and Class B retail licensees to serve complimentary samples of nonintoxicating beer or nonintoxicating craft beer manufactured in the State of West Virginia and to remove prior restrictions on Class A retail licensees’ ability to serve complimentary nonintoxicating beer samples to customers.

497.title: Relating to the ineligibility for probation of certain defendants
497.description: The purpose of this bill is to deny probation to a criminal defendant previously convicted of two or more prior, unrelated felonies.

498.title: Providing that attorneys-at-law may not be involuntarily appointed as counsel in any judicial matter
498.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that attorneys-at-law may not be involuntarily appointed as counsel in any judicial matter; and that members of the Legislature who are attorneys-at-law may not be involuntarily appointed as counsel in any judicial matter, regardless of whether the Legislature is in session or out of session.Â The bill also provides that a lawyer may voluntarily request to receive court appointments.

499.title: Eliminating good time credit for inmates who have been convicted on a prior occasion of another felony offense in an unrelated matter
499.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate good time credit for inmates who have been convicted on a prior occasion of another felony offense in an unrelated matter that was not part of the same criminal transaction as the current conviction.

500.title: Relating to certain defendants ineligible for probation
500.description: The purpose of this bill is to make certain defendants who have been convicted of two or more prior unrelated felonies not a part of the same criminal transaction ineligible for probation. The bill also establishes a procedure.

501.title: Clarifying that theft of a controlled substance is a felony
501.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that theft of a controlled substance is a felony.

502.title: Relating to special funds of boards of examination or registration
502.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Legislative Auditor to conduct review of the fee structure of a specific board of examination or registration when its special fund exceeds twice its annual budget or $10,000, whichever is greater. It also requires the Legislative Auditor to report to the Joint Standing Committee on Government Organization.

503.title: Requiring members of the State Police to follow the towing services policy of the county
503.description: The purpose of this bill is to require members of the State Police to follow towing services policies of the counties in which they are located.

504.title: Authorizing the Department of Motor Vehicles to issue certain vital records in the custody of the State Registrar
504.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the authority to the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue certain vital records subject to the rules and regulations of the State Registrar, to allow the DMV to collect fees for issuing vital records that will be provided to the State Registrar, and for the Commissioners of the DMV and DHHR to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding to implement a program that allows the DHHR to provide access to certain vital records to the DMV.

505.title: Relating to campus police officers of state institutions of higher learning
505.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize institutions of higher learning to appoint all qualified individuals to serve as campus police officers.Â

506.title: Permitting pawn brokers to disclose whether any specific property has been sold or pledged
506.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow pawn brokers to reveal whether any property has been sold or pledged to the broker.

507.title: Exempting the sale and installation of mobility enhancing equipment from the sales and use tax
507.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the sale and installation of mobility enhancing equipment and the sale and installation of repair or replacement parts of mobility enhancing equipment from the sales and use tax and to establish the definition of mobility enhancing equipment in this section.

508.title: Making it easier the renewal of driver license with the designation of “Veteran” and to provide a lifetime license for certain veterans
508.description: The purpose of this bill is to make easier the Â renewal of driver license with the designation of “Veteran” and to provide a lifetime license for veterans over age 65 with some qualifications.

509.title: Permitting salary increases for full time official court reporters based upon years of service
509.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit salary increases for full time official court reporters based upon years of service.

510.title: Authorizing the tracking of wounded or injured deer or bear with leashed dogs
510.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the tracking of wounded or injured deer or bear with leashed dogs. The bill also clarifies what is to be done with dogs that have hunted or chased deer.

511.title: The Campus Self Defense Act
511.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a person who holds a current and valid license to carry a concealed deadly weapon to carry such a weapon on the campus and in the buildings of a state institution of higher education. It provides exceptions and immunity to an institution for a licensee’s intentional or unintentional use of a firearm while carrying it under the act.  The bill seeks to acknowledge that violence against disarmed law-abiding citizens is an increasing, but unnecessary, occurrence. The bill is an attempt by the Legislature to reaffirm a law-abiding citizen's Second Amendment Right, the right to protect themselves by allowing legally licensed and permitted employees, staff, and students of public universities the right to legally carry a concealed weapon within specified limitations.

512.title: Relating to the Antihazing Law
512.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the definition of hazing to address any type of organization whose members include students at any public or private institution of higher education.

513.title: Relating to permitting fur-bearer parts
513.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit fur-bearer parts, including, but is not limited to, glands, skulls, urine, essence, claws, baculum and meat of game or fur-bearing animals, and the hides and tails of squirrels to be sold, traded or bartered.

514.title: Authorizing minors with a graduated driver’s license to pump gasoline
514.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize minors with a graduated driver’s license to pump gasoline.

515.title: Increasing the amount of time a taxpayer has to seek relief from a county commission from an erroneous assessment
515.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of time a taxpayer has to seek relief from a county commission from an erroneous assessment.

516.title: Permitting a pharmacist to convert prescriptions authorizing refills under certain circumstances
516.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide authority for pharmacists to convert prescriptions authorizing refills under certain circumstances.

517.title: Tobacco Cessation Therapy Access Act
517.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a pharmacist to dispense tobacco cessation therapy under a standing prescription drug order.

518.title: Creating an offense for public intoxication due to drug use
518.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an offense for public intoxication due to drug use.

519.title: Relating to forgery and other crimes concerning lottery tickets
519.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that any sentence for violation of this statute be for a determinate period.

520.title: Relating to employees of the Commissioner of Agriculture
520.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to employ a general counsel and any other such personnel necessary to perform the duties of the office. This bill is recommended by the Agriculture and Rural Development Committee for introduction and passage during the 2019 Regular Session of the Legislature.

521.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
521.title: Exempting social security benefits from state personal income tax
521.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

522.title: Creating a voluntary certification for recovery residences
522.description: Creating a voluntary certification for recovery residences

523.title: Permitting trained nurses to provide mental health services in a medication-assisted treatment program
523.description: Permitting trained nurses to provide mental health services in a medication-assisted treatment program

524.title: Allowing certain donations by persons renewing their driver’s license or vehicle registration
524.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons renewing their driver’s license or vehicle registration to make donations to the West Virginia 4 H foundation, the West Virginia Farm Bureau Foundation, and the West Virginia Future Farmers of America Educational Foundation in increments of $3, $5, or $10.

525.title: Relating to military service credit for retirement purposes
525.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a West Virginia public employee who first becomes an employee of a participating public employer on or after July 1, 2015, and who has received an honorable discharge, a general discharge under honorable conditions or a medical discharge from the Armed Forces of the United States, to purchase up to 60 months of military service credit for retirement purposes.

526.title: Requiring available materials, supplies, equipment and other items purchased by the state and its agencies to be made in the United States
526.description: The purpose of this bill is to require available materials, supplies, equipment and other items purchased by the state and its agencies to be made in the United States.

527.title: Relating to purchasing exemptions and procedures
527.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the handling of purchases by the Division of Corrections and Rehabilitation.

528.title: Relating to the Mine Subsidence Insurance program
528.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that if a policyholder has other insurance or other sources of remuneration for a loss covered by the mine subsidence insurance, the Mine Subsidence Insurance Fund is only liable for the portion of the loss which the other insurance or other source of remuneration will not cover.Â Â

529.title: West Virginia Black Lung Program
529.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Black Lung Program and granting entitlement for pain and suffering for occupational pneumoconiosis.

530.title: Providing banking services for medical cannabis
530.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide banking services for services provided under the West Virginia Medical Cannabis Act.

531.title: Allowing private entities to lease buildings to local school boards in cases of emergency or condemnation
531.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county boards of education to lease buildings that meet existing standards from private organizations or businesses in cases of emergency or condemnation.

532.title: Prohibiting the waste of game animals, game birds or game fish
532.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the waste of big game animals and game fish, and create a misdemeanor with criminal penalties for the violation thereof.

533.title: Requiring certain safety measures be taken at public schools
533.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certain safety measures be taken at public schools.

534.title: Permitting directors of county emergency phone systems to obtain mobile-phone emergency lines
534.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend §24-6-5 by permitting the director of a county or municipality emergency telephone system to negotiate contracts for emergency mobile-phones in the county in the event landlines are unavailable.

535.title: Increasing the tax on the privilege of severing natural gas and oil
535.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on the privilege of severing natural gas and oil from 5 percent to 7and one-half percent.

536.title: Authorizing local boards of health to assess, charge and collect increased environmental fees for restaurants
536.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize local boards of health to assess, charge and collect increased environmental fees for restaurants.

537.title: Exempting recipients of the distinguished Purple Heart medal from payment of the vehicle registration fee
537.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt recipients of the distinguished Purple Heart medal from payment of the vehicle registration fee for West Virginia residents.

538.title: Excluding from tax equipment installed in a motor vehicle for use of a person with a medical necessity
538.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude the value of durable medical equipment or mobility enhancing equipment when determining the value of the vehicle for imposition of the tax on the privilege of effecting the certification of title of the vehicle.

539.title: Relating to the election prohibition zone
539.description: This is clean-up from the 2018 Regular Session, during which the three-hundred foot electioneering prohibition zone was reduced to one-hundred foot; this section was simply overlooked.

540.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
540.title: Creating a healthy living tax credit against the personal income tax
540.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a healthy living tax credit against the personal income tax.

541.title: Relating to compulsory school attendance
541.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the time, from 10 to five days the number of unexcused absences by a student, when a complaint may be made against a parent or guardian.

542.title: Creating a matching program for the Small Business Innovation and Research Program and the Small Business Technology Transfer Program
542.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a matching program for the Small Business Innovation and Research (SBIR) program and the Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) program.

543.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to develop a method for funding student transportation costs as a stand-alone consideration
543.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to propose a plan to fund school transportation costs as an item separate from the present total state basic foundation program, and providing for better consideration of fixed costs of transportation in counties with low-density population.

544.title: Relating to the intestate share of a decedent's surviving spouse
544.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the intestate share of a decedent's surviving spouse also includes all household goods, appliances and equipment, located at or generally associated with use of the last residence of the decedent if the spouse has been in cohabitation with the decedent in the previous 12 months prior to the death of the decedent. The bill makes an exception for items of sentimental value.

545.title: The Motion Picture Open Captioning Act
545.description: The purpose of this bill is to require exhibitors of motion pictures who operate two or more theatres in more than one location in this state to provide open captioning during at least two showings per week of each motion picture that is produced and offered with open captioning. The bill requires, when requested, audio description be provided for any motion picture that is produced and offered with audio description.

546.title: Relating to transfers and enrollment policies for students in public schools
546.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the transfer and enrollment policies for students in public schools.

547.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
547.title: Banning plastic bags
547.description: The purpose of this bill is to ban plastic bags.

548.title: Relating to required notices for air quality permits prior to the permit being granted
548.description: The purpose of this bill is to require specific forms of notice to the public before an air quality permit may be issued.

549.title: Exempting social security and tier one railroad retirement benefits from personal income tax
549.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security and tier one railroad retirement benefits from personal income tax. The bill specifies an effective date. The bill removes obsolete language.

550.title: Adding the definition of grantee to include state spending units and local governments
550.description: The purpose of this bill is to add the definition of grantee to include state spending units and local governments and to require grantees to report state grant spending information to grantors.

551.title: Requiring a special report by the Division of Personnel
551.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a special report from the Division of Personnel to the Legislature by September 30 of 2019, regarding classification and compensation section activities, a report on administrative appeals of actions by the division and a report on the specific nature of intervention by the division in grievance and settlement activities.

552.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
552.title: Relating to the operation of state-owned farms
552.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that state-owned farms are managed by the commissioner of the Department of Agriculture; remove reference to farm management commission; define the term “commissioner”; remove language regarding organization and duties of farm management commission; remove language regarding prior transfer of institutional land to the farm management commission; replace outdated language referencing the Department of Health and Human Resources and Division of Corrections and Rehabilitation; provide that state institutions may purchase items from vendors that state owned farms cannot directly produce; and remove references to farm management director and replace with commissioner.

553.title: Expanding the eligibility for service on county school boards
553.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the eligibility for service on county school boards to those running for or serving as a nonpartisan elected official of a class III or class IV municipality.

554.title: Requiring the issuance of a search warrant before a driver of a motor vehicle can be made to submit to a secondary blood test
554.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a search warrant be issued before a driver of a motor vehicle can be made to submit to a secondary blood test to determine the concentration of alcohol or controlled substance in his or her blood.

555.title: Relating to civil asset forfeiture
555.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the state to prove that the owner of seized property has been convicted of a crime and that the seized property was substantially related to said crime before the state can perfect title to seized property; and require that the state return seized property to its owner if the state cannot meet its evidentiary burden.

556.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
556.title: Relating to modification of cottage food laws
556.description: Relating to modification of cottage food laws

557.title: Collecting a user fee from oil and gas producers who use secondary roads in the state
557.description: The purpose of this bill is to collect a user fee from oil and gas producers who use secondary roads in the state. The bill provides for the distribution to the counties a proportional share of the collected fees.

558.title: Changing the rate at which certain judges are paid for mileage
558.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow judges of the Supreme Court of Appeals and of circuit courts, when using their own vehicles, to be paid an allowance for mileage at the rate equal to the amount designated by the Travel Management Office of the Department of Administration for payment to state employees, for certain miles driven, instead of 15 cents per mile.

559.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
559.title: Allowing an individual to petition a circuit court for the expungement of misdemeanor offenses
559.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow an individual to petition a circuit court for the expungement of misdemeanor offenses. The bill requires that the petition may be filed not fewer than 90 consecutive days after the successful compliance with a West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources approved substance abuse treatment and counseling program and graduation from a Department of Education approved Job Readiness Adult Training course, and entering into an agreement with the Department of Health and Human Resources to undergo random drug screenings if required by an employer for a period not to exceed 24 months, with no subsequent violations or random drug test failures after the petitioner began the rehabilitation and counseling program and the adult training course. The bill sets forth what the petition must contain. The bill limits the number of expungements. The bill sets forth a fee.

561.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
561.title: Reinstating the film tax credits
561.description: The purpose of this bill is to reinstate the film tax credits removed by the Legislature in 2018 by the passage of Enrolled Senate Bill 263.

562.title: Providing that schools be closed for two weeks during the holiday season preceding Christmas Day and following New Year’s Day
562.description: The purpose of this bill is to is provide for school closings for two weeks during the holiday season preceding Christmas Day and following New Year’s Day.

563.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
563.title: Providing that the sale and purchase of copper as scrap metal may not be completed with the payment of cash
563.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the sale and purchase of copper as scrap metal may not be completed with the payment of cash, but by check paid to the seller at the address of the seller appearing on a valid driver's license or identification card issued by the West Virginia Division of Motor Vehicles, or any other valid photo identification of the seller issued by any other state or the federal government.

564.title: Making the written plans of municipalities that have been approved by the Municipal Home Rule Board permanent
564.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the written plans of municipalities that have been approved by the Municipal Home Rule Board permanent. The bill provides that all ordinances, acts, resolutions, rules and regulations passed by those municipalities remain in effect until repealed.

565.title: Relating to payment for the construction of any expanded or upgraded public service district facilities in certain circumstances
565.description: The purpose of this bill is to require new commercial and industrial customers to pay for the construction of any expanded or upgraded public service district facilities if the district’s present facilities are insufficient to serve the needs of that commercial or industrial consumer. The bill prohibits any costs being passed on to present consumers.

566.title: Repealing the soft drink tax
566.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the soft drink tax.

567.title: Freezing PEIA employee premiums for three years
567.description: The purpose of this bill is to freeze PEIA employee premiums for three years.

568.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
568.title: Establishing a tax credit for new businesses that locate in the state
568.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a tax credit for new businesses that locate in the state.Â The bill sets forth how the credit is determined.Â The bill establishes the conditions that must be met to qualify for the credit.Â The bill defines terms.

569.title: Authorizing insurance to married workers without children at reduced rates under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Act
569.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize insurance to married workers without children at reduced rates under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Act.

570.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
570.title: Allowing children in the custody of the state in any foster home, group home or other facility or residence to hunt and fish without a license
570.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow children in the custody of the state in any foster home, group home or other facility or residence to hunt and fish without a license.

571.title: Relating to the collection of tax and the priority of distribution of an estate or property in receivership
571.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify conflicts within the code and create uniformity relating to the collection of taxes, the priority of distribution of an estate and to limit the liability of a fiduciary charged with distribution of the estate.

572.title: Reducing state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income
572.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income in calculating the federal gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

573.title: Requiring recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program be issued a photo identification card
573.description: Requiring recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program be issued a photo identification card

574.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
574.title: Exempting all veterans of the Armed Forces or any reserve component thereof from having to obtain a hunting, trapping fishing license
574.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all veterans of the Armed Forces or any reserve component thereof from having to have hunting, trapping and fishing licenses.

575.title: Family Planning Access Act
575.description: The purpose of this bill is permit a pharmacist to dispense a self-administered hormonal contraceptive under a standing prescription drug order.

576.title: Relating generally to funding of Public Employees Health Insurance Program
576.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide more flexibility to the Public Employees Insurance Agency to manage the reserves and financing of the plan on a year-to-year basis.Â The bill requires the PEIA reserve fund to be maintained at an actuarially recommended amount and removes the requirement that any amount in excess of 15 percent of the recommended reserve be transferred out of the fund and into the Retiree Health Benefit Trust Funds.Â The bill establishes the Rainy Day Fee as a dedicated source of funding for PEIA; provides for those funds to be deposited in a new special revenue account created in the State Treasury to be known as the PEIA Rainy Day Fund; and authorizes the Legislature to permit the Secretary of Revenue to assess and collect Rainy Day Fees in subsequent fiscal years of the state.

577.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
577.title: Promulgating a rule for the state building code to require large venues to have portable exit barriers to guide people to targeted exit areas
577.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Fire Commission to propose rule for the state building code to require large venues to have and use portable exit barriers for safer exiting.

578.title: Providing programs to train firefighters and emergency medical technicians
578.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certain community and technical college or career and technical education centers to offer training for students to become firefighters or emergency medical technicians.

579.title: Prohibiting violations of an individual’s civil rights because of disability or sexual orientation
579.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit violations of an individual’s civil rights because of disability or sexual orientation.Â New definitions are added, and changes are to be known as “Angel’s Law”.

580.title: Relating to occupational pneumoconiosis claims
580.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the time limitations provided for filing occupational pneumoconiosis claims in this section does not apply to or otherwise limit the ability of a claimant to obtain an evaluation from the Occupational Pneumoconiosis Board.

581.title: Relating to solar energy on formerly mined land
581.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage solar energy development on lands formerly used for mining, to provide electricity for commercial, industrial and manufacturing businesses or institutions of higher education or nonprofit organizations that are located in or will locate operations in West Virginia is available; authorizing the Public Service Commission to regulate the use of transmission lines to transport power from these facilities; and providing that the solar operations are not regulated as a utility for providing electricity to these businesses.

582.title: Relating to payment of taxes by co owner or others
582.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the payment of taxes by co owners or other interested parties.

583.title: Requiring lighted exit signs in buildings where members of the public may frequent
583.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lighted exit signs with emergency power backup in all building to which the public has access.

584.title: Requiring all boards referred to in Chapter 30 of the code be located in the same area in the state
584.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all boards referred to in Chapter 30 of the code be located in the same area in the state.

585.title: Limiting the increase or decrease of state funding to a county board of education
585.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the increase or decrease of state school funding to any county to 2 percent of what the funding was the previous year.

586.title: Prohibiting railroads from blocking crossings on privately owned streets
586.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit railroads from blocking crossings on privately owned streets.

588.title: Providing for a special “Don’t Tread On Me” license plate
588.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide authority for issuance of a special license plate saying “Don’t tread on me.”

589.title: Creating a hunting permit to safely accommodate visually impaired hunters
589.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a hunting permit to safely accommodate visually impaired hunters. The bill sets forth the permit’s requirements and requires that the permittee and his or her assistant must also hold the underlying hunting licenses or otherwise be exempt. The bill also authorizes rulemaking.

590.title: Relating to submitting a certifying statement attesting to status as a charitable or public service organization
590.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a charitable or public service organization to submit a certifying statement attesting to its status as a charitable or public service organization.

591.title: Awarding service weapons to special natural resources police officers upon retirement
591.description: The purpose of this bill is to make stylistic changes.

592.title: Relating to publication of sample ballots
592.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for an alternative method to publish sample ballots for electronic voting machines.

593.title: Relating to the review and approval of state property leases
593.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the review and approval of state property leases by requiring two signatures and the review and approval of leasing of state property to nongovernment entities.

594.title: Including possession of known stolen property in the offense of receiving or transferring stolen property
594.description: The purpose of this bill is to include possession of known stolen property in the offense of receiving or transferring stolen property.

595.title: Relating to the amount permitted to remain in the West Virginia Alcohol Beverage Control Administration’s operating fund
595.description: The purpose of this bill is to specify the amount of money permitted in the West Virginia Alcohol Beverage Control Administration operating fund that excludes inventory and sets the limit of the operating fund at $8 million.

596.title: Permitting service credit in the Teachers Retirement System to persons with alternative school teaching experience
596.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit service credit in the Teachers Retirement System to persons with alternative school teaching experience.

597.title: Relating to the regular election of officers on state general election day
597.description: The purpose of this bill is to place on the ballot of voters in every municipality of this state that does not hold municipal elections on the state general election day the question of whether the municipality shall hold its future municipal elections on a state general election day.

598.title: Requiring 30 minutes of unstructured play time daily for students in kindergarten through grade 5
598.description: The purpose of this bill is to require 30 minutes daily of unstructured play time for public school students in kindergarten through grade 5.

599.title: Relating to the licensure of nursing homes
599.description: The purpose of this bill is to update references to the secretary and bureau within the agency responsible for regulating nursing homes. This bill also updates the reference to the code of state rules for contested cases, updates the due process procedure, and makes technical cleanup.

600.title: Repealing the requirement of printing the date a consumer deposit account was opened on paper checks
600.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal requiring printing the date a consumer deposit account was opened on paper checks.

601.title: Relating to presumptions of abandonment and indication of ownership in property
601.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent unnecessary reporting and administrative costs associated with reporting of accounts and other property held by a financial organization for active customers of the financial organization.

602.title: Creating a criminal felony offense of aggravated assault or battery of a child or a person who is mentally incapacitated
602.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a criminal felony offense of aggravated assault or battery of a child or a person who is mentally incapacitated.

603.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
603.title: Ensuring Patient Safety Act

604.title: Proposing rules related to the completion or updating of source water protection plans
604.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the secretary to propose rules related to the completion or updating of source water protection plans.

605.title: Prohibiting the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance
605.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of a credit score to banking institution credit scoring for casualty insurance rate filings. The bill prohibits the use of credit scoring as a consideration in calculating insurance rates in homeowners or automobile liability policies. The bill prohibits the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance. The bill prohibits reliance on information which is false or potentially false. The bill limits the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings.

606.title: Providing protective orders for victims of financial exploitation
606.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide protective orders for victims of financial exploitation.Â It defines terms and sets out procedure for filing petitions notice and hearings and appeals. The bill provides for assessing penalties and establishing limitations of time. Rules are authorized, and confidentiality measures are established.

607.title: Requiring the state board of education to develop an elective course on Vocational Agriculture
607.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to develop an elective course on Vocational Agriculture.

608.title: Providing a maximum repair cost for insured owners of motor vehicles if a collision with a deer caused the damage
608.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit costs to insured automobile owners for repairs needed when they hit a deer on a state highway.

609.title: Relating to the form for making offer of optional uninsured and underinsured coverage by insurers
609.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Insurance Commissioner to provide for the use of electronic means of delivery and electronic signing of the form for making an offer of optional uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage by insurers. It also requires an insurer, when offering to place an insured with an affiliate of the insurer, to make available a new uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage offer form.

610.title: Including undue influence as a factor in the definition of financial exploitation of an elderly person or protected person
610.description: The purpose of this bill is to include undue influence as a factor in the definition of financial exploitation of an incapacitated person, elderly person or protected person and to correct technical errors. The amendment is made in the civil cause of action as well as the criminal action.

611.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
611.title: Allowing veterans with certain military ratings to qualify to take an examination for licensing as a plumber, electrician, and sprinkler fitter
611.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow honorably discharged veterans who possess certain military ratings to qualify to take an examination for licensing as a plumber, electrician, and sprinkler fitter.Â The bill also requires agencies to recognize the value of military job skills training and to provide training for certain veterans to facilitate transition from military employment to civilian jobs.

612.title: Modifying the contact requirements with a student’s guardians upon accrual of unexcused absences
612.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the contact requirements with a student’s guardians upon accrual of unexcused absences; specifying that a principal may make meaningful contact with guardians after a student has accrued three unexcused absences; and requiring meaningful contact be made with guardians after a student has accrued three and five unexcused absences.

613.title: Relating to background checks of certain financial institutions
613.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant flexibility to the commissioner in the administration of the licensing programs for mortgage lending and brokering as well as money transmission by clarifying who must submit official criminal history information and to facilitate effective and efficient review of license applications.Â The bill also changes the Division of Banking to Division of Financial Institutions.

614.title: Allowing certified facility dogs to accompany witnesses at criminal trials
614.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the use of specially trained dogs to provide comfort to children and other witnesses that may be comforted by presence of the dog while giving testimony at a criminal trial.

615.title: Requiring the assessor of each county to, within three months of a deed filing in the county clerk's office of each county, prepare a new property tax ticket
615.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the assessor of each county to, within three months of a deed filing in the county clerk's office of each county, prepare a new property tax ticket and cause the tax ticket to be mailed, from the county sheriff's office, to the new property owner to avoid any lapse in which the new property owner may otherwise incur in paying property taxes.

617.title: Establishing reimbursement rates for congregate and in-home meals
617.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the reimbursement rate for congregate and in- home meals.

618.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
618.title: Relating to emergency medical services
618.description: The purpose of this bill is to continue the Office of Emergency Medical Services as an independent office within the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety.Â It updates definitions; creates the positions of Executive Director, Medical Director and Administrative Director for the Office; and establishes and clarifies the powers and duties of the directors.Â The bill reconstitutes the Emergency Medical Service Advisory Council with nine members.Â And, it provides requirements for the state medical protocols.

619.title: Removing all costs and fees from a Silver Star registration plate
619.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove all fees for the initial issuance or renewal of a Silver Star registration plate.

620.title: Including volunteer firefighters within the Public Employees Insurance Act
620.description: The purpose of this bill is to include volunteer firefighters within the Public Employees Insurance Act and require the county commissions to pay either three-fourths or the full amount of premiums.

621.title: Ending tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike effective July 1, 2019
621.description: The purpose of this bill is to end tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike effective July 1, 2019.

622.title: Requiring each county school board to employ at least one full time school nurse
622.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards to employ at least one full time nurse for each public school.

623.title: Relating to qualifying children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program
623.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

625.title: Issuing a special registration plate for persons who are residents of this state and who have a family member diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder
625.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a special license plate for any person with a family member driver diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder.

626.title: Requiring school bus aides, who are trained in preventing bullying and providing a safe environment for students while being transported on a school bus, to be present on school buses
626.description: The purpose of this bill is to require school bus aides, who are trained to prevent bullying and to provide a safe environment for the students while being transported on a school bus, to be present on school buses.

627.title: Granting all public employees, all teachers, all service employees, all public employee retirees, all teacher retirees and all service employee retirees a $1,000 per year permanent pay increase
627.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant all public employees, all teachers, all service employees, all public employee retirees, all teacher retirees and all service employee retirees a $1,000 per year permanent pay increase.

628.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
628.title: Exempting volunteer firefighters from fees for hunting, fishing and trapping licenses and permits
628.description: The purpose of this bill is to waive the fees for hunting, fishing and trapping licenses or permits for individuals who are currently serving as volunteer firefighters.

629.title: Excluding electric generating facilities designated as an exempt wholesale generator from being regulated by the PSC
629.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude electric generating facilities designated as an exempt wholesale generator from being regulated by the commission; requires electric generating facilities owners, operators, or constructors, intending to generate electricity for sale not designated an exempt wholesale generator to only be subject to the commission to obtain a siting certificate prior to construction; and to exclude electric generating facilities from siting requirements to make modifications to facilities.

630.title: Increasing the penalties for overtaking and passing a school bus
630.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for overtaking and passing a school bus.

631.title: Placing a limit on the salary of a county superintendent of schools
631.description: The purpose of this bill is to cap the salary of a county superintendent of schools at $130,000.

632.title: Making all inmates regardless of sex eligible to work on a state convict road force
632.description: The purpose of this bill is to make all state inmates regardless of sex members of the state convict road force.

633.title: Requiring owners of oil and gas wells to install and maintain separate meters that calculate the amount of production from those wells
633.description: The purpose of this bill is to require owners of oil and gas wells to install and maintain separate meters that calculate the amount of production from those well. The bill requires the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to work with the State Tax Commissioner to implement procedures allowing the Office of Oil and Gas to verify production. The bill requires the information be shared with county assessors and royalty owners. The bill requires rule-making.

634.title: Clarifying what constitutes an action requiring service to the Attorney General and notice to the Legislature
634.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that actions that do not require monetary payments by a government agency, and other similar actions, do not mean “judgment” as defined in this article, and therefore do not require prior notice to the Legislature and Attorney General.

635.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
635.title: West Virginia Farm Fresh Raw Milk Act
635.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the West Virginia Farm Fresh Raw Milk Act. The bill authorizes the production and sale of raw milk by milk producers, requires producers to use best sanitary milking and milk handling practices, and establishes sanitary and other requirements for production and sales.

636.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
636.title: Allowing an owner of Japanese quail to keep them as pets without having to obtain a license
636.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow an owner of Japanese quail (Coturnix Quail and Button Quail) to keep them as pets without having to obtain a license for a private game farm.

637.title: Relating to power of security guards to arrest individuals
637.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide arrest authority for security guards on the property the guard is employed to protect.

638.title: Providing a safe harbor for employers to correct underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due to separated employees
638.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a safe harbor for employers to correct underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due to separated employees prior to the filing of a lawsuit. The bill prohibits an employee from seeking liquidated damages or attorney’s fees when bringing an [BP3] action for the underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due upon the employee’s separation of employment without first making a written demand top that employer. The bill permits only those employees who have made a written demand on the employer to be included in a class action brought for the underpayment or nonpayment of wages and benefits due upon the employee’s separation of employment. The bill defines the term “written demand”.

639.title: Self Storage Limited License Act
639.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a limited lines insurance license for self storage providers and to establish procedures for regulatory authority by the offices of the Insurance Commissioner.

640.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
640.title: Continuing education for registered nurses and advanced nurse practitioners
640.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt RNs and Advanced Nurse Practitioners from certain types of continuing education requirements.

641.title: Providing state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel
641.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel.

643.title: Relating to pharmacy benefit managers
643.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a pharmacy benefit manager who contracts with the state to provide certain information to the state and to covered individuals.

644.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
644.title: Relating to public health

645.title: Creating a presidential service registration plate
645.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of a special registration plate for recipients of the federal Presidential Service Badge.

646.title: Removing certain vehicles from the requirement for vehicle inspection
646.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the motor vehicle inspection requirements of this state motor vehicles that are otherwise described as or considered family vehicles , light trucks, motorcycles or light trailers.Â The bill requires the Superintendent of the West Virginia State Police to propose rules defining these exempt vehicles.

647.title: Increasing the modification reducing income for personal income tax for retired teachers and retired state employees
647.description: normal'>The purpose of this bill is to increase the modification reducing income for personal income tax purposes for retired state teachers and retired state employees.

648.title: Health Care Choice Act
648.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Health Care Choice Act authorizing insurers from other states to engage in the business of health insurance in West Virginia with the written approval of the Insurance Commissioner and subject to qualifications and other requirements determined by the Insurance Commissioner.

649.title: Relating to registration of military surplus vehicles
649.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for registration and use of military surplus vehicles.

650.title: Relating to the State Fire Marshall’s comprehensive report
650.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the State Fire Marshall’s comprehensive report regarding the transfer of authority and responsibility of fire services to the counties.

651.title: Establishing a tax on the production of natural gas to fund the public employees insurance program
651.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a new fee on each MFC of natural gas produced to fully fund PEIA benefits at current levels; allow a tax credit for value added jobs in West Virginia for persons paying this fee; and creating a special reserve account to assume that sufficient moneys are collected to preserve the existing insurance program for a 5-year period, then allowing excess proceeds to be directed to general revenue.

652.title: Relating to the manner in which actual investment of capital and costs and a natural gas utility’s expedited cost recovery are calculated
652.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the manner in which actual investment of capital and costs and a natural gas utility’s expedited cost recovery are calculated and determined by the Public Service Commission.

653.title: Relating to natural gas utilities
653.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a natural gas utility to make a request for proposal for incentivized gas drilling where dependable, lower-priced supplies of natural gas are not readily available. The bill permits a natural gas utility to recover the cost reasonably necessary to convert a customer to an alternate fuel source when gas service to that customer has been abandoned. The bill permits natural gas utilities to recover those costs.

654.title: Relating to certificates or employment of school personnel
654.description: Providing for the automatic termination of a service personnel employment contract and the automatic revocation of a bus driver’s certificate if the employee or bus driver are convicted of certain crimes

655.title: Exempting buildings or structures utilized exclusively for agricultural purposes from the provisions of the State Building Code
655.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt buildings or structures utilized exclusively for agricultural purposes from the provisions of the State Building Code which may be adopted by any county or municipality.

656.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
656.title: The West Virginia Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act
656.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act. The bill provides a short title. The bill defines terms. The bill sets forth the duties of the state office within the Department of Health and Human Resources that deals with refugees. The bill permits moratorium applications and cessations. The bill requires a fiscal impact assessment. The bill requires reports. The bill requires the Department of Health and Human Resources to administer the West Virginia Refugee Resettlement Program Plan. The bill provides a severability provision.

657.title: Supplemental appropriation for PEIA Rainy Day Fee
657.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for the fiscal year 2019.

658.title: Supplemental appropriation to the Department of Veterans’ Assistance
658.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for the fiscal year 2019.

659.title: Supplemental appropriation to the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety, Division of Corrections
659.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for the fiscal year 2019.

660.title: Supplemental appropriation to the Department of Administration, Public Defender Services
660.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for the fiscal year 2019.

661.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
661.title: West Virginia Child Advocate for the Protection of Children Act
661.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to West Virginia Code to provide a child advocate for the protection of children.

662.title: Relating to damages for medical monitoring
662.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish limits applicable to the award of damages for medical monitoring.Â

663.title: Prevention of Deceptive Lawsuit Advertising and Solicitation Practices Act
663.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent the deceptive use of lawsuit advertising and solicitation by prohibiting people from engaging in those activities and providing criminal penalties.

664.title: Exempting honorably discharged veterans of the from payment of fees and costs for a license to carry deadly weapons
664.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States from payment of fees and costs required by this section for a license to carry deadly weapons. This exemption already applies to former law-enforcement officers who are honorably retired.

665.title: Creating the Oil and Gas Abandoned Well Plugging Fund
665.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt low volume oil and gas wells from severance tax, and to provide for a special use fee on sales from oil and gas wells which produce more than 5,000 cubic feet of natural gas or one-half barrel of oil per day but less than 60,000 cubic feet of natural gas or 10 barrels of oil per day. The special use fee shall be used by the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to plug abandoned oil and gas wells.

666.title: Creating a student loan repayment program for a mental health provider
666.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a loan repayment program for a mental health provider.

667.title: Employer Property Protection Act
667.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a private right of action for employers against any employee who misappropriates the employer’s property.

668.title: Permitting common carriers to operate in any county of this state
668.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit common carriers to operate in any county of this state.

669.title: Repealing the article providing for Provider Sponsored Networks
669.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the article providing for Provider Sponsored Networks.

670.title: Eliminating the personal property tax on new vehicles
670.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the personal property tax on new vehicles purchased by and registered to a resident of this state.

671.title: Relating to state issued identification cards
671.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the issuance of a state issued identification card without a photo on the card, based upon certification that taking a photograph would violate religion tenet or religious belief.

672.title: Relating to third-party litigation financing
672.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish Consumer Litigation Funding requirements, including definitions, financier requirements, prohibitions, mandatory contract language, third party agreements, violations, and contingency rights.

673.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
673.title: Providing guidance for prosecuting attorneys in cases involving abused and neglected children
673.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to the West Virginia Code to provide guidance for prosecuting attorneys in cases involving abused and neglected children and a means of resolving conflicts with representatives of the DHHR.

674.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
674.title: Establishing a bill of rights for foster parents
674.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a bill of rights for foster parents.

675.last_action: To House Senior, Children, and Family Issues
675.title: Establishing a bill of rights of children in foster care
675.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a bill of rights for children in foster care.

676.title: Relating to exempting “specie” from taxation
676.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt “specie” from personal property assessments, consumer sales tax, personal income tax and corporate net income tax. The bill defines the term “specie.”

677.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
677.title: Refugee Information Act
677.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Refugee Information Act.

678.title: Relating to permitting the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia to create a family drug court pilot program
678.description: Relating to permitting the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia to create a family drug court pilot program

679.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
679.title: Exempting law enforcement and emergency vehicles from paying turnpike tolls
679.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt law enforcement and emergency vehicles from paying turnpike tolls.

680.title: Requiring air conditioning on all school buses
680.description: The purpose of this bill is to require air conditioning on all school buses.

681.title: Relating to replacing the present crime of burglary with the crime of home invasion
681.description: The purpose of this bill is to replace the present crime of burglary with the crime of home invasion. This bill provides for the criminal offenses of home invasion in the first, second, third and fourth degrees. The bill prescribes penalties.

682.title: Relating to guaranty associations
682.description: The purpose of this bill is to update Article 26A to maintain consistency with the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Model Act.

683.title: Providing that a license to carry a concealed deadly weapon expires on the holder’s birthday
683.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a license to carry a concealed deadly weapon expires on the holder’s birthday.

684.title: Relating to primary elections and procedures
684.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the filing date for nomination certificates for candidates for primary and general elections Â be the same for independent and third party candidates as for recognized political parties.

685.title: Relating to traffic violations as qualifying for deferred adjudication
685.description: The purpose of this bill is to include traffic violations as qualifying for deferred adjudication and completion of an approved defensive driving course as permissible terms or conditions of deferred adjudication.Â

686.title: Relating to the state’s ability to regulate hemp
686.description: The purpose of this bill is relating to the state’s ability to regulate hemp production by submitting a plan to the Secretary of Agriculture; providing for continued production of industrial hemp without an approved plan for state regulation; providing for negligent violations of the state plan; providing for requirements to correct negligent violations; and, providing for revocation of an industrial hemp license for repeat negligent violations of a state plan.

687.title: Relating to purchases made by the Director of the Division of Protective Services for equipment to maintain security at state facilities
687.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the State Purchasing Division purchases made by the Division of Protective Services for security equipment to maintain security in state buildings.

688.title: Creating an additional index system for state-owned lands
688.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a naming convention to records lands owned by the state in an index system for easy cross-reference to county indexes.

689.title: The Occupational Licensing Consumer Choice Act
689.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Occupational Licensing Consumer Choice Act to allow persons to work for employers or consumers without first obtaining a professional license.

690.title: Authorizing the Division of Corrections and Rehabilitation to release to county prosecutors of this state certain information
690.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety to release certain information to county prosecutors of this state and United States Attorneys which are required for the prosecution of a criminal action.

691.title: Relating to municipal annexation by minor boundary adjustment
691.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the land area annexed by municipal annexation by minor boundary adjustment shall include that 50 percent or more of the land area annexed is occupied residential.

692.title: Requiring the Public Employees Insurance Agency to use the West Virginia Medicaid Prescription Plan
692.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Public Employees Insurance Agency to use the West Virginia Medicaid Prescription Plan as its Pharmacy Benefits Manager provided the cost to the end consumer are lower. The bill requires rulemaking.

693.title: Relating to general restrictions for outdoor advertising
693.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit advertising signs, displays or devices to be erected by businesses, industrial parks or points of interest up to 1000 feet from the premises of the businesses, industrial parks or points of interest that may not be seen from the roadway due to terrain or other obstructions.

694.title: Relating to the wireless enhanced 911 fee
694.description: The purpose of this bill is to redirect portions of the Wireless Enhanced 911 Fee that are distributed to state agencies to a newly created Public Safety Wireless Fee so that the state and counties may become eligible for certain federal grants.

695.title: Relating to refunds of excise taxes collected from dealers of petroleum products
695.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the cap on the amount of tax that may be refunded to a dealer of petroleum products for gallons lost due to evaporation.

697.title: Redistricting of the Senate into 16 two-member senatorial districts and redistricting the House into 96 single member districts
697.description: The purpose of this bill is to create 16 two-member senatorial districts and 96Â single-member delegate districts based on the 2010 census and implemented during the 2020 elections.

698.title: Relating to statement and computation of teachers' service for members of the State Teachers Retirement System
698.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude time spent as an officer with a statewide professional teaching association from credit as service toward retirement calculation for members in the Teachers Retirement System.

699.title: Relating to the apportionment of representation
699.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that for nomination and election to the House of Delegates, in every delegate district having two or more delegates there shall be numbered divisions corresponding to the number of delegates in each delegate district.

700.title: Local Government Labor and Consumer Marketing Regulatory Limitation Act
700.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Local Government Labor and Consumer Marketing Regulatory Limitation Act. The bill prohibits political subdivisions from enacting any ordinance, regulation, local policy, local resolution or other legal requirements regulating certain areas of the employer-employee relationship and the sale or marketing of consumer merchandise. The bill sets forth prohibited areas of regulation. The identifies exceptions. The bill sets forth a purpose, defines terms and provides for private causes of action.

701.title: Relating to hunting licenses
701.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the list of names, addresses and contact information for hunting license holders from public disclosure with certain exceptions.

702.title: Prohibiting manufacturing plants from locating within two air miles of an existing public school
702.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit manufacturing plants from locating within two air miles of an existing public school without the written permission of the county school board.Â The bill also requires that that a majority of the school board voted to grant this permission.

703.title: Requiring public hearing for applicant for air quality permit relating to facility of certain investment value
703.description: The purpose of this bill is to require public hearings on air quality permits for large facilities, in the county where the facility is to be located.

704.title: Relating to death penalty for first degree murder
704.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree.Â Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

705.title: Expunging records of unsubstantiated complaints made by the Department of Health and Human Resources against teachers
705.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove from the permanent records of school employees and the Department of Health and Human Resources, documentation regarding unsubstantiated complaints filed against the employee that the school board took no action upon.

706.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
706.title: Relating generally to sediment control during commercial timber harvesting operations
706.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter certain sediment control requirements during commercial timber harvesting operations. The bill increases the threshold amount before a logger must follow certain licensing requirements regarding sediment control. The bill requires the logger to notify the Director of the Division of Forestry at least three days before timbering begins. The bill requires certain training requirements prior to recertification of certified loggers. The bill provides for appeals. The bill increases criminal penalties. The bill removes certain limitations on issuing citations and powers of arrest.

707.title: Relating to Class Q special hunting permit for disabled persons
707.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the conditions of permanent disability required for issuance of a Class Q permit.

708.title: Relating to vessel lighting and equipment requirements
708.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify lighting and ventilation requirements for motorboats operating on waters of the state.

709.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
709.title: Authorizing the Division of Forestry to investigate and enforce timber theft violations
709.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Forestry to investigate and enforce timber theft violations on all lands.

710.title: Requiring purchasers of roundwood to collect and maintain certain information
710.description: The purpose of this bill is to require purchasers of roundwood to collect and maintain certain information. It requires sellers to provide updated information to purchases prior to purchase. It also provides criminal penalties for failure to record, maintain or for falsifying required information.

711.title: Establishing an optional bus operator in residence program for school districts
711.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a Bus Operator in Residence program to assist school districts with inadequate substitute bus operator pools.

712.title: Authorizing certain investigators and first responders to carry firearms
712.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize supervising entities to authorize reserve deputies, ambulance crew members, firefighters, rescue squad members and emergency service personnel to carry firearms. It specifies the training required for them to be eligible to carry a firearm and allows them to be reimbursed for the cost of the training.

713.title: Relating to the compensation of personnel employed at the West Virginia Schools for the Deaf and the Blind
713.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify a minimum salary scale for personnel employed by the West Virginia Schools for the Deaf and Blind, and to authorize the state board to establish salary schedules for additional compensation for certain teachers.

714.title: Requiring the use of statutory income tax rates for ratemaking purposes for certain public utilities
714.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that state and federal income tax rates are to be used for ratemaking purposes for public utilities that are part of a publicly-traded, consolidated group.

715.title: Placing penalty points on driver’s licenses for using electronic communications devices while operating a motor vehicle
715.description: The purpose of this bill is to place penalty points on driver’s licenses for using electronic communications devices while operating a motor vehicle.

716.title: Small Business Tax Credit
716.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a temporary tax credit for small group employers to cover a tax credit of up to 50 percent of the costs of branding, marketing and advertising of agricultural or manufactured products produced or manufactured in West Virginia. The bill establishes limits. The bill provides that the credit be available for five years. These sections have been completely rewritten; therefore, they have been completely underscored.

717.title: Relating to preventing compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including certain sums
717.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including sums that the claimant has not and will not pay for medical care or treatment.

718.title: Entitling natural resource producers to the economic opportunity tax credit
