1110.description: Relating to mandatory drug testing for state legislators and teachers

1111.title: Relating generally to the ethical standards for elected and appointed officials and public employees
1111.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the class size of similarly situated persons or businesses that includes a person who is also a public official, excluding members of the Legislature, that determines whether a public official may vote on a matter before him or her. The bill increases the class size from 5 to 200.

1112.title: West Virginia Beverage Container Recycling and Litter Control Act
1112.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the use of returnable containers for soft-drinks, soda water, carbonated natural or mineral water, other nonalcoholic carbonated drinks and for beer, ale or other malt drinks of any alcoholic content and for certain other beverage containers; to require the use of unredeemed bottle deposits; prescribe the powers and duties of certain state agencies and officials; and to prescribe penalties and remedies. This article is new; therefore, strike throughs and underscoring have been omitted.

1113.title: Enacting fair workweek employment standards
1113.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact fair workweek employment standards for certain retail, hospitality, and food services establishments, and property services companies to meet certain employment standards. The bill would require notice of work schedules and require compensation for changed work schedules. It would also require a right to rest between work shifts and require an offer of certain work to existing employees. It provides protections for the exercise of rights and prohibits retaliation.

1114.title: Requiring state institutions of higher education adopt policies and programs relating to sexual assault, domestic violence, and stalking
1114.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state institutions of higher education and community and technical colleges to implement policies and programs relating to sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence and stalking, including adoption of an “affirmative consent” standard in conduct rules and disciplinary proceedings at each institution.

1115.title: Taxpayer Protection Act
1115.description: The purpose of this bill is to creating The Taxpayer Protection Act, providing definitions; stating when a recipient corporation is subject to subsidy recapture, or rescission, and providing for enforcement actions.Â This type of legislation is also called “Clawbacks and Rescissions”.

1116.title: Prohibiting civil rights violations based on disability, gender identity or sexual orientation
1116.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit civil rights violations based on disability gender identity, or sexual orientation. The bill provides that evidence of constitutionally protected speech or associations is not admissible in criminal prosecutions except in certain situations. The bill provides for sentencing alternatives for persons convicted of violations. And, the amendments to this section are to be known asÂ “Angel’s Law”.

1117.title: Coordinating a plan to provide the first two years of post-secondary education for free
1117.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the quality of the state’s workforce by increasing access to college, community college and career education through providing the first two years of Â free tuition.

1118.title: Providing an exemption from the consumer sales and service tax for purchases of certain services and tangible personal property sold for the repair, remodeling and maintenance of aircraft
1118.description: Providing an exemption from the consumer sales and service tax for purchases of certain services and tangible personal property sold for the repair, remodeling and maintenance of aircraft

1119.title: Relating to the Secondary School Activities Commission and participation by home schooled students
1119.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow home-schooled students to participate in secondary school extracurricular activities.

1120.title: Changing the recommended guidelines for full-day and half-day cooks to the minimum ratio of one cook for every 110 meals
1120.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the minimum ration of school cooks to one cook for every 110 meals prepared and served.

1121.title: Be Exceptional Starting Today Act
1121.description: The purpose of this bill is to legalize cannabis, provide for taxation of cannabis, and allow cannabis market activity as regulated by the Department of Commerce.

1122.title: Creating three separate job titles for school bus operators
1122.description: The purpose of this bill is to create three separate job titles for school bus operators based on years of service. The bill establishes pay scales.

1123.title: Relating to providing salary adjustments to employees of the Department of Health and Human Resources
1123.description: Relating to providing salary adjustments to employees of the Department of Health and Human Resources

1124.title: Relating to exempting providers that serve no more than 30 patients with office-based medication-assisted treatment
1124.description: Relating to exempting providers that serve no more than 30 patients with office-based medication-assisted treatment

1125.description: Relating to requiring a parolee or probationer found to have suffered with addiction to participate in a support service

1273.title: Super-Majority Required for Passage of Tax Bill Amendment
1273.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the Constitution to require that bills imposing a tax or license fee and bills increasing the effective rate of any tax levied or fee imposed may not be enacted unless two-thirds of the members of each house, present and voting, vote in the affirmative for passage.

1274.title: Homestead Exemption Increase Amendment
1274.description: The purpose of this resolution is to increase the homestead exemption from $20,000 to $30,000.

1275.title: Term Limits for Senators and Delegates in the West Virginia Legislature
1275.description: The purpose of this resolution is to limit the number of terms a senator or delegate may serve in the West Virginia Legislature.

1277.title: Senators and Delegates Service Limit Amendment
1277.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the Constitution of the State of West Virginia to limit persons serving as Senators or Delegates from serving more than 12 total years.

1278.title: State Apportionment Commission
1278.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would allow citizens to participate directly in the formation of legislative districts by creating a nonpartisan citizen commission which will hold public hearings around the state and present a redistricting bill to the Legislature.

1279.title: Volunteer Emergency Service Personnel Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1279.description: Â The purpose of this resolution is to exempt each volunteer emergency service worker, including each volunteer firefighter, from ad valorem property taxation on the first $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1280.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1280.title: Right to Hunt and Fish in West Virginia Amendment
1280.description: Right to Hunt and Fish in West Virginia Amendment

1281.title: Disabled Veteran's Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1281.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the state Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States who have been determined to have a ten percent or more disability from ad valorem property taxation on the first $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1282.title: Veteran's Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1282.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the state Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States from ad valorem property taxation on the first $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1283.title: Senior Citizen Homestead Valuation Amendment
1283.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose a constitutional amendment that would lock the value of a homestead property owned by a citizen of 65 years of age or older, for the purpose of calculating property taxes, at the assessed value when the owner-occupier turned 65 or purchased the property, whichever occurred later.

1284.title: Manufacturing Inventory and Equipment Tax Exemption Amendment
1284.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution that would exempt personal property in the form of manufacturing inventory and manufacturing equipment from ad valorem taxation.

1285.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
1285.title: Veteran's Additional Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1285.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the state Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States who served during a period of war from ad valorem property taxation an additional $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1286.title: Urging Congress to call a convention of the states limited to proposing amendments to the Constitution of the United States and to limit the terms of office for Members of the United States House of Representatives and set a limit on number of terms for a Members of the United State Senate
1286.description: The purpose of this resolution is to apply to and urge Congress call a convention of the states, under the authority reserved to the states in Article V of the United States Constitution, limited to proposing amendments to the Constitution of the United States, and limit the terms of office for persons elected to the United States House of RepresentativesÂ or to the United States Senate.

1287.title: Legislator Term Limit Amendment
1287.description: The purpose of this resolution is to prohibit Senators and Delegates from serving more than eight consecutive years in the Legislature.

1288.title: Senators and Delegate Service Limit Amendment
1288.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to limit persons serving as Senators or Delegates from serving more than sixteen total years.

1289.title: Business Inventory, Machinery and Equipment Tax Exemption Amendment
1289.description: The purpose of this resolution is to establish that the valuation, assessment value, and exemption from ad valorem property taxation of tangible inventory, machinery and equipment personal property directly used in business activity shall be determined exclusively as provided by law.

1290.title: Property Tax Relief for Seniors and Disabled Veterans Amendment
1290.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose a constitutional amendment that would lock the value of a homestead property owned by a senior citizen at no more than the assessed value when he or she turned 65 or purchased the property whichever is later and to exempt from property tax the principal residence of a veteran who was totally and permanently disabled in service to our country.

1292.title: Taxpayer Bill of Rights
1292.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to §51, Article VI of the Constitution to establish a general fund expenditure limit.Â The amendment is designated “Taxpayer Bill of Rights.”

1293.title: Elimination of Personal Property Tax Amendment
1293.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to eliminate the state personal property tax over a five-year period beginning in 2021.

1294.title: State Redistricting Commission
1294.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would allow citizens to participate directly in the formation of legislative districts by creating a nonpartisan citizen commission which will hold public hearings around the state and present redistricting legislation to the Legislature.

1295.title: Just Cut Taxes and Win Amendment
1295.description: The purpose of this resolution is to submit the proposed “Just Cut Taxes & Win Amendment” to the Constitution of the State to the people of the State for ratification or rejection at the primary election of 2020.

1297.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1297.title: Natural Resources and the Public Estate Amendment
1297.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide the people with the right to clean air, pure water, and maintenance of our State’s natural resources for current and future generations.

1298.title: Giving the Legislature more control over the manufacture and sale of alcohol amendment
1298.description: The purpose of this resolution is to giving the Legislature more control over the manufacture and sale of alcohol.

1299.title: Initiative, Referendum, and Recall Amendment
1299.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to give the people the powers of initiative, referendum and recall. The resolution sets forth its scope,

1300.title: Requiring two-thirds vote of the Legislature to override a veto by the Governor amendment
1300.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would require two thirds vote of the Legislature to override a veto by the Governor.

1301.title: Limiting the terms of members of the House of Delegates amendment
1301.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the Constitution that authorizes the method by which one-house of the House of Delegates can be elected every four years and to limit the number of years a delegate may serve.
